{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Business Development Manager",
  "description": "Uncle Stan&#39;s Foods is a small chops company known for its unique finger food taste all over Lagos. Our brand makes us unique.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	Identify new business opportunities, develop pipelines, and implement sales strategies.
	Acquire and manage clients, conduct energy assessments, and present proposals.
	Collaborate with technical teams on proposals, system designs, and BOQs.
	Develop partnerships, channel networks, and represent the company at industry events.
	Track sales metrics, revenue performance, and maintain accurate CRM records.


Qualifications &amp; Experience


	B.Sc./HND in Business Administration, Marketing, Engineering, Economics, or related fields.
	3&ndash;5years of business development or sales experience; renewable energy experience is advantageous.
	Proven track record in B2B sales, proposal development, and client acquisition.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;emmy@unclestansfoods.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",
  "datePosted": "2025-12-09",
  "validThrough": "2026-01-01",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Uncle Stan's Food"
    
  },

    "@type": "Place",

Business Development Manager Job at Uncle Stan's Foods




        
    

        
        Uncle Stan's Foods is a small chops company known for its unique finger food taste all over Lagos. Our brand makes us unique.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Manager

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Identify new business opportunities, develop pipelines, and implement sales strategies.
	Acquire and manage clients, conduct energy assessments, and present proposals.
	Collaborate with technical teams on proposals, system designs, and BOQs.
	Develop partnerships, channel networks, and represent the company at industry events.
	Track sales metrics, revenue performance, and maintain accurate CRM records.


Qualifications & Experience


	B.Sc./HND in Business Administration, Marketing, Engineering, Economics, or related fields.
	3–5years of business development or sales experience; renewable energy experience is advantageous.
	Proven track record in B2B sales, proposal development, and client acquisition.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: emmy@unclestansfoods.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Order Fulfilment Officer",
  "description": "Mara Cruiz Organics is a Nigerian hair care brand specializing in natural, plant-based products designed for African hair textures.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Order Fulfilment Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Surulere, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities
Order Processing:


	Receive customer orders from sales channels (website, WhatsApp, Instagram, walk-ins, etc.).
	Confirm order details, quantities, delivery address, and payment status.
	Update orders into the internal system or order tracking sheet.


Inventory Coordination:


	Cross-check stock availability before fulfilling orders.
	Communicate with the production team when stock is low or a refill is needed.
	Ensure accurate documentation of items removed from inventory.


Packaging:


	Ensure all items for each order are picked correctly.
	Pack orders neatly and according to the company&rsquo;s packaging standards.
	Attach receipts, labels, and necessary documentation.


Logistics &amp; Dispatch:


	Arrange dispatch riders, courier services, or park delivery depending on the location.
	Provide riders with accurate delivery details and instructions.
	Track dispatched orders and ensure customers receive their items on time.
	Resolve delivery issues promptly.


Customer Communication:


	Notify customers once their orders have been dispatched.
	Provide tracking information where applicable.
	Follow up to confirm successful delivery.


Record Keeping &amp; Reporting:


	Maintain an updated order fulfillment log (daily/weekly).
	Document pending, shipped, returned, or cancelled orders.
	Submit daily and weekly reports to the Operations Manager.


Quality Control:


	Ensure all products going out meet quality standards.
	Report damaged, defective, or missing items immediately.


Coordination &amp; Teamwork:


	Work closely with Sales, Production, and Customer Service teams.
	Ensure proper communication flow for smooth fulfillment operations.
",
  "datePosted": "2025-12-09",
  "validThrough": "2025-12-15",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Mara Cruiz Organics"
    
  },

Order Fulfilment Officer Job at Mara Cruiz Organics




        
    

        
        Mara Cruiz Organics is a Nigerian hair care brand specializing in natural, plant-based products designed for African hair textures.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Order Fulfilment Officer

Job Location: Surulere, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities
Order Processing:


	Receive customer orders from sales channels (website, WhatsApp, Instagram, walk-ins, etc.).
	Confirm order details, quantities, delivery address, and payment status.
	Update orders into the internal system or order tracking sheet.


Inventory Coordination:
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Cross-check stock availability before fulfilling orders.
	Communicate with the production team when stock is low or a refill is needed.
	Ensure accurate documentation of items removed from inventory.


Packaging:


	Ensure all items for each order are picked correctly.
	Pack orders neatly and according to the company’s packaging standards.
	Attach receipts, labels, and necessary documentation.


Logistics & Dispatch:


	Arrange dispatch riders, courier services, or park delivery depending on the location.
	Provide riders with accurate delivery details and instructions.
	Track dispatched orders and ensure customers receive their items on time.
	Resolve delivery issues promptly.


Customer Communication:


	Notify customers once their orders have been dispatched.
	Provide tracking information where applicable.
	Follow up to confirm successful delivery.


Record Keeping & Reporting:


	Maintain an updated order fulfillment log (daily/weekly).
	Document pending, shipped, returned, or cancelled orders.
	Submit daily and weekly reports to the Operations Manager.


Quality Control:


	Ensure all products going out meet quality standards.
	Report damaged, defective, or missing items immediately.


Coordination & Teamwork:


	Work closely with Sales, Production, and Customer Service teams.
	Ensure proper communication flow for smooth fulfillment operations.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Sales Representative",
  "description": "DrugStoc is a tech-enabled pharmaceutical access and distribution platform that connects manufacturers of pharmaceutical products to health care providers in sub-Saharan Africa. Founded in 2015, Our clients are hospitals, pharmacies, clinics, and nursing homes. We are an omnichannel platform that removes any barrier for Licensed health workers to find and purchase genuine medication at the right price for their patients.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Sales Representative
Job Location:&nbsp;Akure, Ondo
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Summary


	Drive sales in assigned territory, grow customer base, manage relationships, ensure order fulfillment, and provide market insights.


Requirements


	BSc in Pharmacy / Life Sciences / Business / Marketing
	3&ndash;5+ years field sales experience (pharma preferred)
	Strong selling, negotiation, CRM, and reporting skills
	Valid driver&rsquo;s license + willingness to travel.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;careers@drugstoc.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",
  "datePosted": "2025-12-09",
  "validThrough": "2026-01-10",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "DrugStoc"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Ondo",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },

    "value": "191570"
  },

Sales Representative Job at DrugStoc




        
    

        
        DrugStoc is a tech-enabled pharmaceutical access and distribution platform that connects manufacturers of pharmaceutical products to health care providers in sub-Saharan Africa. Founded in 2015, Our clients are hospitals, pharmacies, clinics, and nursing homes. We are an omnichannel platform that removes any barrier for Licensed health workers to find and purchase genuine medication at the right price for their patients.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Sales Representative
Job Location: Akure, Ondo
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Drive sales in assigned territory, grow customer base, manage relationships, ensure order fulfillment, and provide market insights.


Requirements


	BSc in Pharmacy / Life Sciences / Business / Marketing
	3–5+ years field sales experience (pharma preferred)
	Strong selling, negotiation, CRM, and reporting skills
	Valid driver’s license + willingness to travel.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@drugstoc.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Electrical Engineer",
  "description": "ICS Outsourcing is Nigeria&rsquo;s pioneer Human Resource Outsourcing Company. We are on a mission to provide world-class human resource solutions, using experts while creating value for our shareholders and opportunities in the community. Our vision is to be the most valuable Business Support Solutions Partner to our Clients throughout Africa and beyond.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Electrical Engineer

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time
Work Mode: Onsite (Full-Time)
Industry: Power Equipment Installation &amp; Maintenance

Job Summary


	We are seeking skilled and dedicated Electrical Engineers to join our client&rsquo;s technical team responsible for the installation, servicing, and maintenance of power equipment including UPS systems, inverters, stabilizers, FM200 fire detection systems, and cooling/HVAC units.
	The ideal candidates will have strong hands-on technical expertise, excellent troubleshooting skills, and the ability to work efficiently in a fast-paced engineering environment.


What You&rsquo;ll Do


	Install, test, and maintain power systems and electrical equipment
	Support FM200 fire detection and HVAC system maintenance
	Conduct preventive and corrective maintenance on-site
	Prepare technical reports and service documentation
	Ensure compliance with safety standards.


Requirements


	HND in Electrical Engineering (Upper Credit)
	Knowledge of power systems, electrical installations, and troubleshooting
	Hands-on experience with UPS, inverters, stabilizers, HVAC, or FM200 systems is a plus
	Strong teamwork, problem-solving, and communication skills.


Salary
N200,000 - N250,000 / month (Attractive).

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;cudeh@icsoutsourcing.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",
  "datePosted": "2025-12-09",
  "validThrough": "2025-12-13",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "ICS Outsourcing"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Lagos",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",

    "value": "191563"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 150000,
      "maxValue": 250000,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Electrical Engineer Job at ICS Outsourcing




        
    

        
        ICS Outsourcing is Nigeria’s pioneer Human Resource Outsourcing Company. We are on a mission to provide world-class human resource solutions, using experts while creating value for our shareholders and opportunities in the community. Our vision is to be the most valuable Business Support Solutions Partner to our Clients throughout Africa and beyond.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Electrical Engineer

Job Location: Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time
Work Mode: Onsite (Full-Time)
Industry: Power Equipment Installation & Maintenance

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking skilled and dedicated Electrical Engineers to join our client’s technical team responsible for the installation, servicing, and maintenance of power equipment including UPS systems, inverters, stabilizers, FM200 fire detection systems, and cooling/HVAC units.
	The ideal candidates will have strong hands-on technical expertise, excellent troubleshooting skills, and the ability to work efficiently in a fast-paced engineering environment.


What You’ll Do


	Install, test, and maintain power systems and electrical equipment
	Support FM200 fire detection and HVAC system maintenance
	Conduct preventive and corrective maintenance on-site
	Prepare technical reports and service documentation
	Ensure compliance with safety standards.


Requirements


	HND in Electrical Engineering (Upper Credit)
	Knowledge of power systems, electrical installations, and troubleshooting
	Hands-on experience with UPS, inverters, stabilizers, HVAC, or FM200 systems is a plus
	Strong teamwork, problem-solving, and communication skills.


Salary
N200,000 - N250,000 / month (Attractive).

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: cudeh@icsoutsourcing.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     




        
        

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});

  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Customer Service Agent",
  "description": "Singa Cash provide quick and affordable loans to Nigerians, and werecruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Customer Service Agent
Job Location:&nbsp;Ogba, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We&rsquo;re looking for Customer Service Agents who are passionate about delivering exceptional customer experiences and ready to join a fast-paced contact centre environment immediately.
	If you have the right experience and you&rsquo;re eager to grow, this is a great opportunity for you!


Responsibilities


	Respond to customer inquiries via phone, email, or chat promptly and professionally.
	Provide accurate information on products, services, and company policies.
	Resolve customer issues with patience and empathy.
	Escalate complex cases where necessary.
	Maintain accurate records of all interactions.
	Follow established scripts, guidelines, and best practices.
	Support overall customer satisfaction goals.


Requirements


	6 months - 1 year of experience in Customer Service (Fintech or Contact Centre experience is an added advantage).
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to multitask and stay organized in a busy environment.
	Strong problem-solving attitude with a positive mindset.
	Familiarity with CRM tools is a plus.
	Must reside within Ogba/Ikeja or 40 minutes away (Lagos Mainland).
	Willingness to work Mondays through Sundays on a shift schedule.
	Available for immediate employment.


Salary
N110.000Monthly (Nett).
note: If you work on weekends, you will receive N5,000 in cash

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:sarah.vincent@singa.ng&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

Customer Service Agent Job at Singa Cash




        
    

        
        Singa Cash provide quick and affordable loans to Nigerians, and werecruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Customer Service Agent
Job Location: Ogba, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We’re looking for Customer Service Agents who are passionate about delivering exceptional customer experiences and ready to join a fast-paced contact centre environment immediately.
	If you have the right experience and you’re eager to grow, this is a great opportunity for you!


Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Respond to customer inquiries via phone, email, or chat promptly and professionally.
	Provide accurate information on products, services, and company policies.
	Resolve customer issues with patience and empathy.
	Escalate complex cases where necessary.
	Maintain accurate records of all interactions.
	Follow established scripts, guidelines, and best practices.
	Support overall customer satisfaction goals.


Requirements


	6 months - 1 year of experience in Customer Service (Fintech or Contact Centre experience is an added advantage).
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to multitask and stay organized in a busy environment.
	Strong problem-solving attitude with a positive mindset.
	Familiarity with CRM tools is a plus.
	Must reside within Ogba/Ikeja or 40 minutes away (Lagos Mainland).
	Willingness to work Mondays through Sundays on a shift schedule.
	Available for immediate employment.


Salary
N110.000Monthly (Nett).
note: If you work on weekends, you will receive N5,000 in cash

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:sarah.vincent@singa.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply
